name: Bergamot
climate: Bergamot thrives in a temperate climate with mild winters.
It can also grow in a Mediterranean climate with hot dry summers.
Avoid very cold climate zones as Bergamot is not frost-tolerant.
Humidity levels should be moderate to prevent fungal diseases.
sunlight: Bergamot requires full sun exposure for optimal growth.
Ensure it receives direct sunlight for at least 6-8 hours a day.
Partial shade can be tolerated but may reduce flowering.
Avoid dense shade as it can hinder plant development.
watering: Bergamot needs regular watering during dry periods.
Ensure the soil is moist but not waterlogged to prevent root rot.
Reduce watering in the winter months when growth slows.
Use a deep watering method to encourage strong root growth.
soil: Rich, well-draining soil is ideal for Bergamot cultivation.
A loamy soil texture with good organic matter is preferable.
Avoid heavy clay soils that retain excessive moisture.
A slightly acidic to neutral soil pH will support its growth.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage denser growth.
Monitor for aphids and spider mites as they can infest Bergamot.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Protect the plant from strong winds, especially in exposed locations.
